definition: to do one's utmost
to exhaust
power/force/strength/ability/strenuously
surname Li
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost

sentences.english: But the country has every intention of safeguarding its food supply.
sentences.chinese: 但是中國已經在竭力捍衛其糧食供應。

sentences.english: The proposal has long been pushed by former high-ranking Talibans.
sentences.chinese: 這個計劃曾一直被塔利班前高層竭力推進。

sentences.english: But the cafeteria is doing its best to force me to be a vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 但是飯堂竭力在強迫我成爲一名素食主義者。

sentences.english: Jackman reportedly requested to have Luhrmann stage the Oscar number.
sentences.chinese: 據稱傑克曼竭力邀請魯爾曼執導奧斯卡舞臺。

sentences.english: Marguerite, extremely pale and with her mouth half open, was trying to catch her breath.
sentences.chinese: 瑪格麗特的臉色蒼白，嘴半張着，竭力想喘過氣來。

sentences.english: Scarlet dropped her head on her arms and struggled not to cry.
sentences.chinese: 思嘉將頭伏在臂膀上，竭力忍住了哭。

sentences.english: He fought tooth and nail to stop the county from pulling down the old church.
sentences.chinese: 他竭力阻止縣裏拆除那座老教堂。

sentences.english: He set off once more in spite of his friends' attempts to dissuade him.
sentences.chinese: 儘管朋友們都竭力勸阻，他還是再一次踏上了征途。

sentences.english: Make me remember He wants me to press through.
sentences.chinese: 叫我能記住他要我竭力走到底。

sentences.english: We are strenuously opposed to whaling and strenuously opposed to violence at sea.
sentences.chinese: 我們竭力反對捕鯨，反對海上暴力事件。

sentences.english: I said, endeavoring to snatch the glass from his hand.
sentences.chinese: 我說，竭力想從他手裏奪過杯子。

sentences.english: People with chronic lung diseases fight for air while doing simple tasks.
sentences.chinese: 慢性肺病患者在從事簡單勞動的時候都需要竭力呼吸。

sentences.english: 1：We spent weeks trying to dig up dirt on this guy.
sentences.chinese: 我們幾星期來都在竭力挖那傢伙的醜事。

sentences.english: After a while his left hand and remove the tendons , but he is still to adhere to.
sentences.chinese: 過了一會他的左手又抽起筋來，但他仍竭力堅持。

definition: to make a supreme effort/at all costs
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to strive/to make an effort/to exert oneself
to try hard to/to strive to
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
to attempt/to try
to use up/to exhaust
to do everything one can/to spare no effort/to strive
so as to/for the purpose of/in order to
to try/to make an attempt/to think of a way (to accomplish sth)
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
to attempt/to try/attempt/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
repeatedly
in order to
lit. thousand ways, a hundred plans (idiom); by every possible means
